articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday pushed back against a new wave of pressure to reach a cease-fire deal in Gaza after hundreds of thousands of Israelis protested and went on strike and U.S.
articles.title: Netanyahu pushes back against new pressure over Gaza and hostages: 'No one will preach to me'

articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — An Israeli-American family that became an international symbol in the struggle to free hostages from Hamas captivity in Gaza laid their son to rest on Monday after the discovery of his body and those of five others brought a fresh outpouring of grief.
articles.title: 'We all failed you.' Heartbreak at funeral for Israeli-American hostage in Jerusalem

articles.author: REGINA GARCIA CANO and JORGE RUEDA
articles.description: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) — Venezuelan authorities on Monday sought an arrest warrant for the opposition's former presidential candidate Edmundo González, just over a month after election officials declared President Nicolás Maduro the winner of a disputed election that his opponents say he lost.
articles.title: Venezuelan prosecutor seeks arrest warrant for opposition's former presidential candidate

articles.author: COLLEEN LONG, ERIN B. LOGAN and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: PITTSBURGH (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris used a joint campaign appearance with President Joe Biden in the critical swing state of Pennsylvania on Monday to say that U.S.
articles.title: Harris opposes US Steel's sale to a Japanese firm during joint Pennsylvania event with Biden

articles.author: DEE-ANN DURBIN
articles.description: More than 10,000 workers at 25 U.S. hotels were on strike Monday after choosing Labor Day weekend to amplify their demands for higher pay, fairer workloads and the reversal of COVID-era cuts.
articles.title: Labor Day hotel strikes reflect the frustrations of a workforce largely made up of women of color

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, REGINA GARCIA CANO and JOSHUA GOODMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. government has seized a luxury jet used by Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro that officials say was illegally purchased through a shell company and smuggled out of the United States in violation of sanctions and export control laws.
articles.title: US government seizes plane used by Venezuelan president, citing sanctions violations

articles.author: DAVID BILLER and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — A Brazilian Supreme Court panel on Monday unanimously upheld the decision of one of its justices to block billionaire Elon Musk’s social media platform X nationwide, according to the court’s website.
articles.title: Brazil Supreme Court panel unanimously upholds judge's decision to block X nationwide

articles.author: AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As a young college student, Kamala Harris made the nearly 3-mile trip from Howard University to the National Mall to protest against apartheid in South Africa.
articles.title: Howard University's capstone moment: Kamala Harris at top of the ticket

articles.author: HOWARD FENDRICH
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Jessica Pegula is back in the quarterfinals at the U.S. Open after a 6-4, 6-2 victory over Diana Shnaider on Monday, her seventh trip to that round at a Grand Slam tournament.
articles.title: US Open: Jessica Pegula reaches her 7th Grand Slam quarterfinal. She is 0-6 at that stage so far

articles.author: HILARY FOX
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Ian McKellen is listening to his inner critic.It’s beating him up for not finishing out his latest theater role after he fell off the stage during a June performance of “Player Kings” and spent three nights in the hospital.
articles.title: Q&A: Ian McKellen is his own harshest critic as he discusses his stage fall and new thriller
